Articles.Content: I started playing KSP on my windows laptop and the [SHIFT]+scroll wheel worked in the rocket hanger for zooming in and out.  But when I play on my Mac it doesn't.  I can still press on the mouse wheel and move the mouse froward and back to zoom, but it would be nice if I could just shift+scroll again.
There are zoom keys that don't need the mouse.  KP+ zooms in and KP- zooms out.  As with all key bindings, these can be changed in the settings menu before you start or continue a game.

On 12/29/2015 at 9:26 AM, Geschosskopf said:

There are zoom keys that don't need the mouse.  KP+ zooms in and KP- zooms out.  As with all key bindings, these can be changed in the settings menu before you start or continue a game.

By which he means "keypad" + and -. If you're using a laptop, though, you may not have these. you'll need to re-map them in the Settings menu (Settings->Input->Game->Camera group)

1 hour ago, pincushionman said:

They also sell little USB keypads for about $10.  I have one for my laptop.

My question is: can I get the shift+scroll to work on my mac?

the + - as well as the clickwheel+mouse work, but they're really slow compared to the shift/scroll
